Earthquake shakes Kazakhstan's biggest cityAn earthquake jolted Kazakhstan's biggest city of Almaty on Monday, sending dozens of people scurrying to safety outdoors as sirens went off. Mon, 04 Mar 2024 06:58:16 GMT IS63IQ6LYZI3VFA26PLMC7R67I https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/earthquake-shakes-kazakhstans-biggest-city-2024-03-04/Reuters商业环境
Russia's foreign ministry summons German ambassador, TASS reportsRussia's foreign ministry summoned the German ambassador on Monday, the TASS news agency reported, citing an unidentified source, after Russian media published an audio recording of a meeting of senior German military officials. Mon, 04 Mar 2024 06:51:46 GMT JVCHB6G6IBMRFF55QIGKNYUOJ4 https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/ Russias-foreign-ministry-summons-german-ambassador-tass-reports-2024-03-04/Reuters世界欧洲
China cancels premier's press conference for first time since 1993China's Premier Li Qiang will not hold a press conference after the close of this year's annual parliamentary meeting, an official said on Monday, ending a tradition maintained for three decades. Mon, 04 Mar 2024 06:48:26 GMT W73DOSAV4JOSNGRD5GYST4KZCU https://www.reuters.com/world/china/china-cancels-premiers-press-conference-first-time-since-1993-2024-03-04/Liz Lee, Albee Zhang世界中国

Hungarian PM Orban to meet Trump on March 8 in FloridaHungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban will meet former U.S. President Donald Trump on March 8 in Florida, Orban's press chief told Hungarian state news agency MTI late on Sunday. China opposes using anti-espionage law to attack its business environmentChina opposes any attempt to denigrate or attack its business environment by misreading the country's counter-espionage law, National People's Congress (NPC) spokesman Lou Qinjian told reporters at a press conference on Monday. Mon, 04 Mar 2024 05:22:55 GMT M3JBDA7CFZIIPHF4VX3WZDEHZE https://www.reuters.com/world/china/china-opposes-using-anti-espionage-law-attack-its-business-environment-2024-03-04/Reuters世界中国
Malaysia ready to re-open probe of missing MH370 if new evidence emergesMalaysia is willing to re-open an investigation into one of the world's greatest aviation mysteries, the disappearance of Malaysia Airlines MH370 in 2014, if there is compelling new evidence, Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim said on Monday. Thai Supreme Court clears ex-PM Yingluck in negligence case - lawyerThailand's Supreme Court cleared self-exiled former Prime Minister Yingluck Shinawatra of negligence on Monday, her lawyer and local media said, in a case dating back to her time in office in 2013. China to hold 2024 parliamentary meeting from March 5-11China's National People's Congress (NPC), or parliament, will hold its annual meeting in Beijing from March 5 to March 11, NPC spokesman Lou Qinjian told reporters at a news conference on Monday. Mon, 04 Mar 2024 04:14:06 GMT HTV66OXADBM2HEWIZCUOJVB46Y https://www.reuters.com/world/china/china-hold-2024-parliamentary-meeting-march-5-11-2024-03-04/Reuters世界中国
SpaceX launches eighth long-duration crew for International Space Station orbitA SpaceX rocket safely lifted off from Florida on Sunday night carrying a crew of three U.S. astronauts and a Russian cosmonaut on their way to the International Space Station (ISS) to begin a six-month science mission in Earth orbit. Russian warship arrives in Qatar for defence exhibition, Interfax reportsRussia's Pacific Fleet frigate Marshal Shaposhnikov entered the Qatari port of Hamad where it will take part in the DIMDEX-2024 defence exhibition, Interfax news agency reported on Monday, citing the press service of fleet. Mon, 04 Mar 2024 02:56:31 GMT 633DKR44TBOUBKRR5KQUNNHE7A https://www.reuters.com/world/ Russian-warship-arrives-qatar-defence-exhibition-interfax-reports-2024-03-04/Reuters世界
